content.raw: I believe this is an issue in ROS. I've created a simple node that exhibits this same behavior: https://github.com/azeey/sandbox/tree/master/ros_high_cpu. My guess is having a `ros::NodeHandle` that remains alive for the duration of the node is what fixed the problem. I'll go ahead and approve this since we haven't seen any spikes or crashes.
content.html: I believe this is an issue in ROS. I've created a simple node that exhibits this same behavior: https://github.com/azeey/sandbox/tree/master/ros_high_cpu. My guess is having a ros::NodeHandle that remains alive for the duration of the node is what fixed the problem. I'll go ahead and approve this since we haven't seen any spikes or crashes.
